abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the Economic Reform
            Support Operation Credit Project is to support the
            completion of an important phase in the Ghanaian reform
            program. In particular, it recognizes the significant recent
            progress made in restoring macroeconomic stability. The
            Credit Project also seeks to support the Government's
            efforts to lay the foundations for the next phase of
            difficult and complex reforms in the areas of public sector
            reform, public expenditure management, privatization, and
            the energy and cocoa areas. The Credit Project will help
            cover the external financing requirements of Ghana in the
            context of a vulnerable external position and low level of
            external resources. The components include: (a) promotion of
            the private sector; (b) Accelerated Divestiture Program
            (ADP); (c) human development and poverty reduction; (d)
            public service reforms; (e) privatization, of the
            Electricity Company of Ghana and the Produce Buying Company;
            and (f) re-organization of the functions and procedures of
            the Office of the President and The Cabinet Secretariat.
